text: The Deir el Qamar Synagogue is a synagogue in Deir el Qamar, Lebanon; it is the oldest synagogue in Mount Lebanon. The synagogue was built in the seventeenth century to serve the local Jewish Lebanese population. Some of them were under the rule of Emir Fakhreddine II. ==Related pages== *History of the Jews in Lebanon *Maghen Abraham Synagogue (Beirut, Lebanon) *Wadi Abu Jamil ==Other websites== *The Jews of Lebanon blog *Corporation of Lebanese Jews in Canada Category:Synagogues Category:Buildings and structures in Lebanon Category:17th-century establishments in Asia Category:History of Lebanon
title: Deir el Qamar Synagogue
